docs.snippet: Monday: Positive stories from the underground, celebrating Alice Coltrane, and the Bunion Derby.
A Times reporter in Kabul has experienced eight suicide bombings since 2016, seven in the last year. Sick of it, she still goes to the scene. “If I don’t, who will?”

headline.print_headline: When the Bombs Explode, There Is Work to Be Done
headline.main: This Is What I Do When I Hear the Bombs Explode

docs.snippet: The trial of Yoselyn Ortega, accused of killing two children in her care, is to begin on Thursday in State Supreme Court in Manhattan.

docs.snippet: For more than 50 years, Nobuyoshi Araki has pushed the limits of free expression. Rope is for him what blue paint was for Yves Klein.
